title: Latest Pixel leak reveals new tools to give your phone a fun makeover
description: Google will soon let you play around with your Pixel's interface via custom emoji wallpapers and Material You widgets.

title: Spotify is finally ready to save you when you forget to download a playlist
description: Spotify's new Offline Mix will automatically download songs to your phone so you can listen anytime, anywhere.

title: Google's Android app will soon let you drag and drop your search results
description: Google is planning to add an AI drag-and-drop feature into its Android app search.

title: Images of Instagram’s Twitter rival have leaked and I couldn't be more hyped
description: Meta is talking to celebrities like Oprah and the Dalai Lama about being early users on the company’s Twitter alternative

title: Human Fall Flat 2 announced with a suitably chaotic reveal trailer
description: Devolver Digital has recently announced it is publishing Human Fall Flat 2, the sequel to the 2017 smash-hit platformer.

title: Netflix's password sharing crackdown is actually working as subscriptions spike
description: Netflix's password sharing crackdown has helped to reverse its subscriber slowdown, according to new data.

title: These 100% replaceable, recyclable headphones are too nice to be just for kids
description: Kibu is created as a positive educational tool to show the environmental impact of headphones you can build, repair and recycle yourself.

title: What is Usenet? 5 things to know about newsgroups.
description: Meet the granddaddy of file-sharing – the one that kick-started everything.

title: Activision removes Nickmercs Call of Duty skin from game following anti-LGBT tweet
description: Nickmercs, a member of FaZe Clan, has his Call of Duty skin removed from the game after problematic tweets

title: Hackers are attacking Minecraft to push malware once again
description: Modders are being targeted with infostealers capable of hijacking cryptocurrency transactions.

title: There's now an open-source SDK for mini quantum computers you can use
description: Quantum Brilliance has just released its Qristal SDK, discussing future plans for quantum computing.

title: 7 new movies and TV shows on Netflix, Max, Prime Video and more this weekend (June 9)
description: From mind-bending Apple TV Plus thrillers to returning Netflix comedy series, there’s plenty to watch this weekend.

title: Google Bard is catching up to Chat GPT in coding, reasoning, and math
description: A new blog post from Google reveals that it's updating Bard's reasoning, coding, logic, and math capabilities.

title: Ransomware gangs are losing interest in US firms
description: Companies in other parts of the world, especially the UK, are being targeted more.

title: This hacking group has been attacking thousands of organizations worldwide
description: Their activities range from cybercrime to espionage, and their endgame remains a mystery.

description: You’ve heard of bone conduction headphones, now meet OneOdio's open-ear ‘air conduction’ solution.

title: Microsoft doesn't want us to be scared of AI - but is it doing enough?

title: Microsoft launches new Porsche edition Xbox Series X - which you can't buy
description: In a rare collaboration, a new Xbox Series X variant was revealed at Summer Games Fest and it's not for sale.

title: Your Android TV could be getting a big upgrade – here’s what’s coming

description: The Oura Ring's new Circles feature called lets you share health data with friends. But is that a good thing?

title: Microsoft OneDrive went down after a spate of DDoS attacks
description: Anonymous Sudan takes responsibility, calls Microsoft "liars".

description: Alongside the desktop changes, Google is rolling out a security update to Chrome on iOS to sniff out weak passwords.
